Hassan (50) arrives at a solitary house made of adobe, in the southern deserts of Morocco, carrying a satchel and a large bundle wrapped in cloth. He walks past a corral made out of branches, where several goats bleat, and knocks on the front door.

direction.raw_text: . YUSSEF AND AHMED'S HOUSE -- MOMENTS LATER Abdullah's family is inside the house. There is a room, a small table and a simple kitchen. Yasira (38) is roasting some goat meat assisted by Yamil (16) and Zora (17), her daughters. Abdullah and his sons, Yussef (13) and Ahmed (14), are sitting on the floor around the small table, looking at a well- conserved .270 caliber Winchester 60 rifle.

direction.raw_text: . YUSSEF AND AHMED'S HOUSE -- DAY Hassan and Abdullah's family are behind the house. Hassan stands with the rifle in front of a rock some twenty yards away and he turns toward Abdullah.

direction.raw_text: He aims at the rock and pulls the trigger without holding the rifle properly. It is clear that he doesn't know how to fire a weapon, and the shot cracks loudly. The rifle kicks and hits him roughly in the shoulder. The bullet flies far wide of the rock. The women laugh nervously. Rubbing his shoulder, Hassan turns to Abdullah.

direction.raw_text: Hassan opens the chamber, inserts the bullet and then closes it. Once it is loaded, he points at the safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahmed nods. Unsure of himself, he raises the rifle and, almost without aiming, fires. The shot kicks up dust far from the rock. His sisters laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahmed lowers the rifle. His father grabs it and gives it to Yussef enthusiastically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef grabs the rifle and loads it confidently. He lifts the rifle with ease and takes his time aiming. He seems innately skilled at the maneuver. He shoots and the bullet hits just below the rock. Abdullah celebrates the shot and mockingly turns to Hassan.

direction.raw_text: . VOLLEYBALL COURT -- DAY In an indoor volleyball court with bleachers, several Japanese girls play volleyball. They all compete intensely for the point. There is excitement, but everything occurs quietly. A player jumps and spikes the ball. Chieko (16), tall, beautiful, with strands of hair painted purple, volleys the ball back up. It reaches one of her teammates who sets up another to spike it. Chieko's team wins the point. The referee, instead of whistling, lifts up a red flag. The players congratulate each other silently, in sign language. The only sound we can here is the parents' clapping as they watch the game from the stands. Chieko's team serves. Again, the game is heated. A rival player spikes the ball, and it is barely out of bounds. However, the referee, with his red flag, calls the point. Chieko is upset and goes to argue with him.

dialogue.raw_text: Son, you look like Pedro Infante.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: More like Luis Miguel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the bride?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's not here yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What d'you mean she's not here yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, she ain't here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look son, these are Mike and Debbie, the kids I take care of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pleased to meet you Mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Psst.   Lucio, come here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are Mike and Debbie. Keep an eye on them for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, HAMLET "LOS LOBOS" -- DAY Amelia is in a room with her two daughters standing in front of a peeling and broken mirror putting on her violet gown. One of her daughters helps her and pulls the zipper all the way up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two sisters realize that the dress has a hole just below the seat, exchange looks and smile, which doesn't please Amelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia looks at them suspiciously, turns around and leaves the room with her dress elegantly torn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (All in Spanish) Oh ma, I don't know how you did it but it zipped up perfectly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it's been 15 years since I last wore this dress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't changed a bit, ma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Working, dear, working, that's what keeps one young.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you guys laughing about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing ma, nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT ROAD, MOROCCO -- DAY The bus is in the middle of the road. Several of the tourists are hiding under their seats, frightened. The driver, still ducking, looks toward the mountains to try to piece together what happened. Richard holds Susan against his shoulder, blood gushing from her neck. Her eyes are open and staring at a fading world. Richard takes Susan from under her armpits and carefully lays her down on the aisle. Anwar runs over to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar takes his shirt off - left only in his undershirt - and puts it under Susan's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan breathes in, and every time she does, blood flows from her wound. Richard turns toward the other passengers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody answers.   Richard starts to lose his cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pensioners don't answer; they are too scared. Richard opens Susan's purse and sees a cell phone. He turns it on and tries to call, but there is no signal. He turns to Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard runs down the aisle and gets out of the bus.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take it easy honey, take it easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mumbling senselessly) I'm ok... I'm ok...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is anybody a doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please: a doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the nearest hospital?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's far away, about four hours. (a beat) There's a clinic that's a little closer, about an hour and a half to the south. By bus it'll take us about two hours and a half though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does that takes away from Marrakesh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but it's the closest thing we've got.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HIGHWAY -- DAY No cars drive by. The road is almost deserted. In the distance, a run-down Renault approaches. Richard stands in the road to stop it. The car brakes and Richard runs toward the driver: an old peasant traveling with his eight year-old grandson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard grows desperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard sees that Anwar and the bus driver have gotten out of the bus and he starts shouting at them for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the distraction, the old man drives off. Richard watches helplessly as they drive away and he grabs Anwar by the arm.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I need your help. We were attacked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) I don't understand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help... hospital...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) I don't understand you sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him we need his help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's take her to the clinic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HIGHWAY -- DAY The bus makes a U-turn and drives away at full speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS -- DAY The bus rattles along. Richard huddles over Susan, trying to stop the blood flowing from her neck. Barth, an old man starts shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard gets exasperated at the old man's screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barth shuts up and the bus drives on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Marrakech isn't this way. They're going to shoot at us again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to get her to a hospital.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going to kill us all. Turn back... turn the bus around...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up, god damn it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HIGHWAY -- DAY The bus bounces its way down the straight highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS -- DAY The passengers sit quietly. As the ride gets bumpier, Susan starts to cry out in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard tries to calm her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard turns her around and sees her shoulder has been shattered. She won't stop shouting. A pool of blood starts trickling down the aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard turns to look at Susan, who is writhing in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard and Anwar exchange a glance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It hurts, it hurts...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy, sweetie, easy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It hurts... it hurts so much...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (A Anwar) Isn't there anywhere else we can take her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can take her to my town. It's near here and there's a doctor. In the meantime we can call Erfourd for an ambulance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To the driver, in Arabic) Make a right onto the next road.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HIGHWAY -- DAY The bus leaves the main road and turns into a dirt road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS -- DAY The bus' poor suspension gives the passengers a jolt.    Richard tries to protect Susan's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET -- DAY The bus pulls into a small group of houses. Several children run beside the bus, chasing it. Some gaunt dogs get out of the way to let the bus by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY The bus pulls up in front of a modest house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS -- DAY Richard raises his head and sees the desolate environs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard tries to carry Susan, but she screams in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips his hands under her and lifts her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Richard moves his hand, which is covered in blood. As he carries her, he turns into the aisle while Anwar and one of the passengers try to help him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are we here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir, this is my house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy, darling, easy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch me there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET -- DAY Richard carries her into the house through a crowd of curious children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Anwar leads Richard down the hallways amidst Susan's screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATIO, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY They walk through a dusty patio and Anwar points at some stairs. Richard climbs them with difficulty and Anwar opens the door to a room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here... here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY An old woman (87), Anwar's grandmother, who has centuries of desert in her expression, lets them in and points at a rug on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard understands and softly lays Susan on the rug. Susan looks around horrified: adobe walls, dirt floor: the epitome of the third world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously, Richard does not have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get ready to leave and Susan starts imploring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan looks desperate. To set Richard somewhat at ease, Anwar points at his Grandmother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard leans over Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar kneels down next to her, takes a cloth and improvises a tourniquet that he adjusts near her shoulder. He turns towards the grandmother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grandmother nods. She sees the swarm of kids looking into the place and she shoos them away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kids obey, except for one or two who take one last look before they go. Susan's terrified eyes watch Anwar and Richard leave the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Put her there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to call an ambulance and contact my embassy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you have the number of the embassy, I can go call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to make a phone call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course, come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't leave me here alone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, I'll be right back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She can take care of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to be ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Hold and release the tourniquet every once in a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Get out of here... out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY The bus is still parked in front of the house. As soon as Richard walks out, the pensioners approach him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom (51), a fat English passenger, faces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Anwar listens and intervenes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lilly (79), an old woman, approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James (82), Lilly's husband, steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Douglas (75), a tall old man with good posture, interjects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elyse (73), his wife, scolds him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Douglas looks defiantly at Tom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How is your wife?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bad. Very bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get her outta there and let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And where should I take her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In Egypt, in a town like this, they slit thirty German tourists' throats. They might do the same to us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Aggressively) What do you know? We have to get out of here as soon as possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's very hot, sir, and the driver turned off the air conditioning. I'm feeling sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't leave us here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the use in staying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In case I need the bus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They can go drop us off and then come back for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll stay with you if you need me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why would you stay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please wait.     Let me try to deal with this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not going to risk our lives, so hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do what you have to do, we'll wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET -- DAY Richard and Anwar walk down the streets of the small hamlet before the people's inquisitive gaze. They arrive at a general store with all sorts of roots and grains displayed outside. Anwar walks over to the owner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Arabic) We need your phone.     I'll pay for the call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Susan is lying on the floor, desolate. It seems as if the pain is diminishing. The grandmother leans over her and softly caresses her with her dirty, wrinkled hands. This startles Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan is a little bit uncomfortable with her this close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old woman doesn't seem to understand. She grabs a basket of dates and offers them to her. Susan shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With her hand, Susan mimes drinking a glass of water. The old woman seems to understand. She pours some water from a jar, leans over her and helps her drink in small sips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grandmother bows her head as if to say "your welcome."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old woman just smiles. Susan makes a gesture of desperation. The grandmother leans over her, unfurls her index finger and points at her heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan keeps looking at her as she slowly gets up and goes to sit in a chair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) How do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I have some water?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's my husband?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Trust in god.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GENERAL STORE -- DAY Richard is in a small cubicle dialing on an old cream-colored rotary phone while Anwar waits discretely in a corner. Dozens of people watch from outside. Richard turns to look at them while the call connects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up. As soon as he does, he turns to Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar, clumsy and stressed at Richard's desperation, takes the phone and starts dialing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he finishes dialing, Anwar turns to Richard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... Rachel? It's Richard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Are you still in Moroccco?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, we're still in Morocco...Rachel, there was an accident, your sister was shot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (Surprised) What? Who shot her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... We were shot at from some hills.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is she ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was hit in her neck and shoulder. Rachel, she's not doing well... I need you to tell the embassy as soon as possible... wait... and call Mark...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anwar, where are we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In Tazarine, three hours southwest of Erfoud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were in Tazarine, T-a-z-a-r-I-n-e Three hours southwest of Erfoud... in the desert... it's a town... there's no hospital... There's nothing here at all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Where are you calling me from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From a shop. Rachel, this is urgent... urgent... call the embassy... They have to help us... call James too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Why did they shoot her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... Rachel, you're sister's badly hurt... do you understand? Call for help... now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call an ambulance...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll call Erfoud so they send one over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And find a doctor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've already gone to look for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Richard returns to the room. Susan, weak, lies with her eyes open. The grandmother is tending to the wound, which won't stop bleeding. She gets up and goes to Anwar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Arabic) Anwar, bring me some water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PATIO, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Anwar goes out to the patio and fetches a metal basin full of soil. He goes to a well, scoops out some water with a gourd and washes out the basin. Anwar is walking back when he is stopped by Mohammed, his brother, a fat man (32) with curly hair and a tanned face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Anwar doesn't pay attention to him and keeps walking toward the room. His brother catches up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar stops and looks at him fixedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar pays no more attention to him and carries the basin into the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (the entire dialogue in Arabic) Why did you bring them here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should have consulted with us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's hurt, we had to take care of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In town they're saying she was shot by terrorists. Do you know what they're going to do to us when they find out she's here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be paranoid and go help find the doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Susan is lying down. A small pool of blood has collected under her neck. She looks restless. She whispers weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then Anwar enters. The grandmother takes the basin and sets it in a corner. She gets some pieces of cloth and starts to soak them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Anwar shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard is going to say something, but holds back.   His despair and confusion are evident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grandmother wrings out the rags and puts them on a table. She takes some herbs, a fistful of earth from the floor and she tosses them into the basin. She stirs it and pulls out a clump of mud which she lays out on one of the pieces of cloth. Susan looks horrified at the dirt. The grandmother leans over her and tries to clean the wound with the other moistened rags. Susan resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grandmother finishes cleaning her with the damp cloths and grabs the clump of mud. She tries to put it on the wound, but Susan flinches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard intervenes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get me out of here... please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to as soon as I can. I've already called Rachel; she's going to tell the embassy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you we shouldn't have come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long until the ambulance gets here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About an hour and a half. It's coming from Alnif.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That much? Isn't there anyone here who could take her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to get her out of here. There's no one to tend to her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My brother already called a doctor, he's coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trust my grandmother; she knows a lot about remedies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) I have to clean you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Susan) Miss, my grandmother is going to help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) It will stop the bleeding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no... not that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Anwar) Let's wait for the doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET -- DAY Two old men walk through the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Mohammed walks into the room and calls him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) The sheik and the moukadem are here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY The two men walk past the tourists and head inside without knocking or asking for permission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATIO, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Richard and Anwar have walked out into the patio to wait for them. The sheik approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Richard and speaks to him in very bad French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard thanks him with a nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard nods.   The sheik continues in Arabic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheik looks at the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard, anxious, questions Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheik and the moukadem turn and exit the house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In bad French) I am Atallah the sheik and this is Walid, the moukadem. I'm very sorry about your wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says he is very sorry about your wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Anwar, in Arabic) Tell him that I want to ask him some questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Richard) Can he ask you some questions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Do you have any enemies in this country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He asks if you have any enemies in this country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Then why were you shot at?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you come to Morocco?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vacation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) He has no idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) What does he do for a living?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you do for a living?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a magazine editor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) He edits magazines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Anti-muslim magazines?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anti-muslim magazines?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, magazine magazines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) No, normal magazines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him we need to get my wife out of here. Ask him if the ambulance is on its way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) He wants to get his wife out of here. He wants to know if the ambulance is on its way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Tell him the federal police are in charge of this, that they are going to send the ambulance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says the federal police are already in charge, that they are going to send the ambulance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Hey, did your cousin finally end up getting married?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Yep, she's married, she doesn't live here anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He gives you his blessing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DENTIST'S OFFICE -- DAY Chieko is sitting in the reception area, waiting her turn. There is a woman with a twelve year-old son listening to a walkman and an old couple. The receptionist (50) will not stop talking to the old lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman continues her banal chatter. Chieko observes her grotesque mouth. She then looks at the old man's bored face, the old woman's feigned interest, the mother's annoyed expression, and the boy, who rocks his head to the music. A man walks out and the receptionist gestures at Chieko and points toward the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My niece sells these creams. And just look at my skin now. I'm going to turn fifty-two and look, almost no wrinkles...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DENTIST'S OFFICE -- DAY The dentist (47) - tall and, unlike the receptionist, with impeccable skin covering his hardened, attractive face - examines Chieko's mouth. His face comes very close to hers as he looks at her, making her nervous. The fat receptionist walks in without knocking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dentist looks up at her. She leaves the drill bits on a table and leaves. The dentist turns back to Chieko and speaks face to face with her so she can read his lips.
direction.name: direction

Among them is a picture of Chieko as a little girl with her father and her mother. Chieko sees a note on the table at the entrance. She puts the policeman's card down and picks up a note from her father that says: "I waited until five and you didn't make it. I've got a meeting and I'll be back late. direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor opens his kit and takes out a rudimentary needle and thread. He gets ready to sew. Richard questions him, also in whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor and Anwar exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar answers naively, in a low voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard looks at him, surprised and angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard can't answer as he focuses on what the doctor says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard remains pensive for a moment. He looks at Susan, then at the doctor and assents tentatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He mimes holding her down with his hands. Richard leans over Susan, who weakly languishes on the rug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares at him. Richard turns to Anwar and signals that he can begin. Anwar holds her hands. Susan, stupefied, to Richard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor lifts Susan's neck and starts to stitch.    She howls in pain and tries to move away. Anwar and Richard hold Susan down.    The doctor sticks the needle in again. Susan shakes her head from side to side trying to pull away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard holds her head to keep her still. She resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The doctor rubs alcohol on the wound and starts to stitch. She moans in pain. Richard puts a rag in her mouth, on which she bites down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) The bullet didn't hit her spine or split her jugular. But it did shatter her clavicle and she could bleed to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says she will be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop lying to me god damn it, and tell me what the fuck he said!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hospital... need hospital...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, we know that. What can you do in the meantime?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic, to Anwar) Tell him I have to stitch up the wound to stop the bleeding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has to sew up her wounds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You need some stitches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean stitches?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to give her any anesthetic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Richard) No, he doesn't use anesthetic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of doctor is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's a veterinarian, but he is good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can't take care of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Richard, he might infect the wound...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Tell him that if I don't stitch up her wound she may bleed to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he doesn't sew up the wound, she may bleed to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic, to Anwar) And tell him her clavicle is broken. We have to fasten a splint to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says she has a broken bone and he has to put a splint on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) We're going to have to hold her down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honey, this is going to hurt a little.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Richard, don't let him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let him, don't let him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Calm down... calm down... Susan, they have to sew you up... relax...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no...no..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honey, please try to relax...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TINY SHOP -- DAY Mohammed sits outside with three friends drinking coffee. From where they are we see the bus and the American tourists. A battery powered radio plays Moroccan music and commercials in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Mohammed focuses on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The friends are quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the friends interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mohammed shouts.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand why Anwar brought them here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well he spends all his time with them, what do you expect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The woman is hurt, he had to help her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?   And when have they helped us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I liked one of those tourists.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?   They're all skin and bones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh... sh... listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Today, near Tazarine, there was an incident where an American was shot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey look, it's the story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They said Tazarine, did you hear? We were on the radio...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh, shut up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Although authorities say it could have been a foiled robbery, the American government claims they are certain it was a terrorist attack. Minister Hassef Hazal has said that in our country, terrorist cells have been eradicated, that Morocco is a peaceful country and that one act of vulgar banditry followed by superficial evaluations such as the U.S. intends to place upon it cannot ruin the image, the economy and the pacifist reputation of our country. American Ambassador Ken Jones, however, insists that it was a terrorist attack on American citizens, that it merits a full investigation, and that the guilty should be punished. So far, the attack has not been attributed to any known terrorist organizations...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I fucking told Anwar, I told him he was only going to get us in trouble... he never comes and when he does he always brings trouble...god damn it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are the Americans going to invade our country?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Susan lies on the floor with her neck shoddily stitched and a splint on her shoulder made out of a few sticks and some dirty bandages. She moans in pain and mumbles curses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to stand, but the doctor impedes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seems obsessed by the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to stand again. As they struggle, the grandmother takes out a hash pipe form a drawer and lights it. She gives it two drags and squats next to Susan. She shows her how to smoke it and hands it over. The old woman's serenity is such that Susan acquiesces. She takes four drags and slowly starts to relax. Susan smokes another three times, relaxes and closes her eyes. The old woman goes to get the clump of mud and starts to spread it on Susan's neck. Susan does not protest. Richard watches the scene in awe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hate you... I hate you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Anwar in Arabic) Tell her not to move; the bullet's still inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Susan) Don't move, miss. The bullet is still inside you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't give a shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My love, don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to call the kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't move, calm down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to talk to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't; there's only one phone in town. I'll call them later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to talk to them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY The bus is still parked outside Anwar's house. Some of the passengers sit leaning against the wall, scrutinized by some of the town's children and women who have offered them tea and dates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUS -- DAY The driver sits in the driver's seat and stares out at the desolate landscape through the windshield. Several of the tourists nap in their seats. One of them, a French tourist, Robert (70), starts to breathe with difficulty. Jane (65), his wife, is alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert nods, but it is clear that he is not.    Jane shouts at the driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver shakes his head regretfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert inhales, he can barely breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom turns to Jane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom stands up and goes to yell at the driver.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) Are you ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) Could you please turn on the air conditioning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In broken French) No air condition, no gasoline near. I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) My husband is feeling ill.     You have to turn it on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) No possible. No gasoline near.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) Please, it's too hot.   We can get dehydrated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In French) I'm really sorry, forgive me, but gasoline finish with air conditioner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is he saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That he can't turn on the air conditioning, that it's not possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you.   We're gettin' out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PATIO, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Tom resolutely walks up the stairs followed by James.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Richard is looking out the window while Susan, relaxed, sleeps. Tom and James walk in making noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard, with his index finger, signals for him to shut up and points at Susan. He gestures for them to leave the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We've gotta talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Tom, James and others are gathered by the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard turns to Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter an English man, one of the older men,    defends him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard breathes, relieved.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't leave us like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are old people here and the heat is getting to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least wait until an ambulance comes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One man almost fainted in the bus and there's a woman who needs to get back in time to take her medication.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there anyone around here who can take them in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, we can't wait anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't leave him here alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well let him come, then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His wife is in no condition to ride a bus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And lots of other people aren't in any condition to keep waiting, can't you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just wait, the ambulance should be here any minute now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're giving you an hour... one hour...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREET, TOKYO -- DAY Chieko walks down the street with Mitsu. They are good- looking and attract attention. They know this and look back out of the corners of their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARK, TOKYO -- DAY They arrive at a park with a playground: swings, see-saws, slides. Several of their deaf-mute volleyball friends are there. With them are two young men with hair dyed blond. One of them, Takeshi (18), has an earring, and the other, Haruki (19), has several tattoos. Mitsu and Chieko greet them in sign language.    Chieko asks the slightly chubby Kumiko who they are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko turns to look at them, curious. Haruki, the guy with tattoos, exchanges a look with her. Chieko suddenly feels intimidated and looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haruki seems to understand what they're saying and leans in to whisper something to Takeshi, his brother. They both laugh. Haruki approaches Chieko and talks to her face to face so she can read his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko and her friend smile.    Chieko takes out her notebook and pen and writes her name.    Haruki reads it out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko nods, trying to show she's understood. Haruki takes out a flask and holds it out to her. Chieko opens it and smells it. Haruki stands in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko smiles and gives a long swig.       Mitsu asks for some and also gives it a long drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haruki takes out some ecstasy and gives it to them. Mitsu and Chieko look at each other and down the pills with a gulp of whisky.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're my cousins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he deaf-mute like us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but he understands some.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chieko?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name's Haruki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's whisky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do the cops come around here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Gutturally) Sometimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . PARK, TOKYO -- LATER Half-drunk and rushing from the pills, Chieko, her friends, and Haruki and Takeshi, play on the swings and see-saw. They laugh at almost anything. Haruki and Chieko are on the see-saw and every time Chieko rises, Haruki looks at her bush. Chieko knows this sometimes opens her legs even more so he can look to his heart's content. Hormones float in the air. Mitsu also takes advantage of the occasion. She flirts with Haruki whenever she can. Haruki looks happy to be the object of their attention. Takeshi, who has started to make out with one of Chieko's friends, turns to the group and speaks slowly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why- don't- we- go- to- Montana?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TAXI, TOKYO -- EVENING Night begins to fall. Haruki sits between Mitsu and Chieko. He strokes Chieko's knee with his hand; she seems turned on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHTCLUB STRIP, TOKYO -- NIGHT The taxi parks outside the Montana. Chieko, Mitsu and Haruki get out of the car and meet with the others at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY, NIGHTCLUB -- NIGHT They enter. The music, the light, the crowd, it is almost hallucinatory. For Chieko, it is a silent concert of movement and chaos. She and her friends push their way through the place. Haruki grabs Chieko by the hand, pulls her toward the floor and starts dancing. Chieko looks at the other dancers' rhythm and follows. She slowly manages to follow. The other deaf-mutes also dance. Some do better than others, lost in the sea of lights and people. For Chieko, the dance turns into something hypnotic. She dances with her eyes closed, concentrated on her own rhythm. When she opens her eyes, she sees that Mitsu, a little drunk, is grinding against Haruki, feeling him up. Chieko seems annoyed by this and goes to defend her territory. She starts dancing next to Haruki, but she is constantly interrupted by the surrounding crowd. The struggle between Chieko and Mitsu is a little bit ridiculous. It is finally resolved when Mitsu takes Haruki by the face and starts to kiss him. Chieko doesn't know what to do. Mitsu and Haruki start to make out intensely. Suddenly Chieko is left standing in the middle of the club, motionless, while her friends dance awkwardly and Mitsu and Haruki are having the time of their lives. Chieko, defeated by her friend, decides to leave. Mitsu spots her out of the corner of her eye and waves goodbye. Chieko smiles back and walks away from her friends as they dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOBBY, TOKYO APARTMENT BUILDING -- NIGHT Chieko enters her building and goes straight to the doorman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko takes out a piece of paper and a pen from her purse and writes a note. She gives it to the doorman together with Kenji's card. He reads it carefully, and when he's done he turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doorman picks up a cordless phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a pause. The doorman gestures to Chieko that the lieutenant will answer in a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko watches attentively.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, how may I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well miss, I'll call him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant Kenji Mamiya, please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant? Yes, look, I'm with the deaf-mute girl you saw in the afternoon, and she asked me to call you... Yes, her... She says she needs to talk to you, alone... about her father... If it's possible, in her apartment, tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . YUSSEF AND AHMED'S HOUSE -- DAY Yussef and Ahmed are sitting against the wall of the house. Yussef's lip is split. Ahmed's nose is bleeding. Abdullah paces desperately, while his wife and daughters watch the scene, silent. Abdullah stops to look at Yussef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't answer.   Abdullah leans over and slaps Ahmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahmed won't answer and he turns to Yussef again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abdullah turns and gives Yussef a powerful slap, which he endures with silent dignity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abdullah turns to Yussef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef is silent. Abdullah walks two steps forward and slaps Zora. He looks furious, scared, indignant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can barely hold in his tears. Zora brings her hand to her face tearily. Abdullah turns to Ahmed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you do this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me, god damn it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were testing the rifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you idiots? You killed a woman, (He turns to Zora) And you, you got naked so your brother would see you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, she got naked lots of times.    I saw how Yussef spied on her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it true or not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you do this to us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the rifle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HASSAN'S HOUSE -- DAY A cop interrogates Hassan. His face is badly bruised and his hands are cuffed behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to look at his wife. She has also been beaten and is guarded by two cops. The interrogating cop authorizes her. She walks in and comes out with a photograph of Hassan with Yasujiro, posing with the scimitar-horned oryx. He hands it over and the cop examines it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What organization gave you the weapon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've told you it wasn't an organization; I got it from a hunter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What hunter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Japanese hunter gave it to me many years ago. I've got a picture inside. She can get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's holding the rifle he gave me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Yussef and Ahmed dig up the rifle and the bullets in front of their parents and sisters. Abdullah grabs the rifle, dusts it off and puts the bullets in his bag. He turns to Yasira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the rifle in hand, Abdullah runs off, followed by Yussef and Ahmed. The women watch them get lost on the horizon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to hide out at Naguib's house. If the cops come, tell them we went south.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HASSAN'S HOUSE -- DAY Alarid's truck parks in front of Hassan's house again. Hassan is still cuffed and being interrogated. Furious, Alarid gets out of the truck and goes toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks over to kick him. The wife intervenes from where she is, some ten yards away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alarid turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a gesture, he orders his subordinates to put her in the truck. She obeys, docile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This Abdullah doesn't live where you said he did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They live where he said they do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to take us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if they're not there, I'll cut your tongue out and I'll kill your husband.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY The Moroccan police trucks drive down the dusty roads.    The landscape is harsh and barren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POLICE TRUCK -- DAY Hassan's wife gives directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alarid, with his hand, signals the driver to follow her directions. Suddenly, in the distance, over the hills, she signals three tiny dots running up a slope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trucks stop and Alarid takes out his binoculars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make a right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To the driver) Stop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ALARID'S BINOCULARS -- CONTINUOUS In the distance, we can still see Abdullah, Yussef and Ahmed run across the hills. Abdullah is clearly carrying the rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Alarid quickly gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the cops get out with their high powered rifles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There they are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HILLS -- DAY Abdullah and his sons run full speed.   Yussef sees the trucks in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They run up a hill to try to lose them, but shots start to ring out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abdullah stands before his sons and lifts up the rifle as a sign of surrender. The shots cease for a few seconds, but they suddenly start again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three shepherds run, huddling as low as they can. More shots. They desperately climb between the rocks. Bullets whiz past everywhere. Abdullah makes one last attempt at surrender. He lifts up the rifle again, sets it on the ground and backs away. But the gesture is in vain, as the bullets still rush past. They begin to run again when Ahmed is hit in one of his calves. He collapses and rolls downhill. Abdullah hurries to rescue him and drags him behind a rock. Ahmed won't stop screaming from the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Yussef dives on his belly and snakes his way through the rocks. He gets the rifle, loads it and aims at the trucks. He shoots without hitting anything.    Abdullah turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef doesn't pay attention.    He loads again and aims.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The police, the police...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're shooting at us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get down.   Run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They shot me, they shot me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot, don't shoot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: RIFLE SIGHTS -- DAY Yussef aims carefully. He picks out one of the cops who has been shooting barely protected by one of the trucks' fenders. Yussef shoots and the policeman collapses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET "LOS LOBOS" -- LATER The religious ceremony has ended and everyone throws rice at the bride and groom. Debbie and Mike enjoy doing it. Several cowboys, among them Santiago, have gone to their trucks and are loudly honking their horns. Music begins to blare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET "LOS LOBOS" -- DAY The band plays various Norteno songs. Everyone waits for the music to start. After a while a couple starts to timidly dance. Then another, and another, until the dance floor becomes a sway of heads moving to the same rhythm. Amelia dances with Mike and Debbie with Santiago; both Amelia and Santiago show them a few steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kicks his heel back, then forward. Debbie watches, entertained. Jacinto (55), overweight and with a good-natured face, moves closer to Amelia and watches her dance for a while, she notices and stops, embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia remains unperturbed, without answering him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amelia stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia looks around and then turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jacinto chivalrously takes her by the waist and they begin to dance. Santiago watches them, amused, and continues to dance with Mike and Debbie. Jacinto draws Amelia closer and they kiss gently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (To Debbie, in Spanish) Like this, look...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Both in Spanish) Amelia, will you let me dance with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been asking you for a dance for
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: years. Does it really cost you that much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET "LOS LOBOS" -- NIGHT Beer starts to flow and some of the guests get overbearing. There is a small scuffle at the edge of the dance floor, but order is soon restored. The guitarist in the band stops the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone makes way for the bride and groom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The audience and the band sing the little cake song. A giant, tacky wedding cake, covered in cream, arrives. The bride grabs the knife and gets ready to cut it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bride gives into the ritual. She tries to take a bite out of the cake without using her hands and someone pushes her face into the cream. Debbie and Mike laugh. A cowboy pulls out a gun and, festively, fires.   Debbie is frightened and goes to hide behind Amelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man puts the gun away and walks back onto the dance floor as if nothing had happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Luis asks the band to stop the music for a little bit and he takes the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody applauds and Luis steps down from the dais, proud of his speech. He goes to Amelia and gives her a very long and loving hug.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (All in Spanish) Now, Luis and Patricia, come forward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We-want-cake, we-want-cake...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take- a- bite, take- a- bite...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, it's ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening everyone... Hey... I want to say something. Love came today, it came here all pretty... (he taps his heart) It's kind of like a little mouse is crawling inside of me. Because that's what love is, it's like your insides get all twisted into knots... and that, baby, is what you've taught me. And because you've shown me, I want to tell everyone that hopefully love will get inside them too...because it feels so good, really...Thanks a lot and keep havin' a good time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET "LOS LOBOS" -- NIGHT Night has fallen. The music plays full blast. Everyone dances, people start to make out, the drunk collapse. Patricia breathes regularly with her hands on her belly. Luis drinks beer beside her while he watches the guests dance. Debbie falls asleep on Amelia's lap while Mike watches the party, overwhelmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORDER CROSSING -- NIGHT Santiago decides to cross through Mesa de Otay. Since it's nighttime, there are very few cars. They drive across the bridge and stop before the immigration officer.

direction.raw_text: Santiago and Amelia take out their passports and their Green cards. The officer compares the documents to their faces again and again.

direction.raw_text: The officer looks through the window and sees Debbie and Mike sleeping in the back.

direction.raw_text: Santiago rushes to answer.

direction.raw_text: Amelia freezes at Santiago's answer.    The officer won't stop looking at the children.

direction.raw_text: Amelia takes out their American passports and shows them to the cop. He looks them over very carefully. Santiago starts to get nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officer turns to look at them suspiciously.    He obviously smells the alcohol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santiago shakes his head.    Debbie wakes up and looks at the officer sleepily.

direction.raw_text: Debbie rubs her eyes.

direction.raw_text: . SANTIAGO'S CAR -- NIGHT Nervous, Santiago glances ahead and looks at the border crossing through his rear-view mirror. He puts the car in reverse and accelerates, trying to escape back to Mexico, but he crashes into an arriving car.

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . IMMIGRATION DESK, BORDER CROSSING -- NIGHT The immigration officers take out their guns and run to stop him. Santiago sees that the road ahead is clear and he drives away full speed, barely swerving around some customs officers who are searching another vehicle. The officer shouts urgently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts a police chase.

dialogue.raw_text: They've kidnapped some kids...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT HIGHWAY -- NIGHT Santiago's car drives full speed down the highway.   He sometimes looks as if he is going to lose control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SANTIAGO'S CAR -- NIGHT Santiago drives madly. Frightened, Amelia holds onto the dashboard. Debbie and Mike start to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A trailer drives slowly. Santiago decides to drive around it blindly, and almost drives off the other side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santiago ignores her, concentrated on his driving. He looks through the rear-view mirror. There is nobody behind him, only the dark highway. Santiago steps on the gas. Amelia tries to comfort the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children won't stop crying, terrified by the speed. Through one of his mirrors, Santiago sees two patrol cars following him with their turrets flashing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santiago accelerates. The car seems to be out of control. The children scream. Amelia tries to stop Santiago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santiago reaches a path and heads toward it.

direction.raw_text: . SANTIAGO'S CAR -- NIGHT Amelia gets out and opens the door for the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kids get out and Amelia holds their hand.   Santiago closes the doors and drives off in a cloud of dust. They start to walk through the darkness. Amelia leads the way, avoiding cacti and thorny branches. The go on like this for a long stretch. The children are quiet and scared. Amelia goes toward the highway and realizes the patrol cars have turned into the path. She runs into the desert with the kids. She can barely see with the light of the early dawn. The three frequently trip on thorny plants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of them, scared, start to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks back worried at where the patrol cars were; they are approaching quickly. Then she turns to where Santiago ran. The headlights are soon lost on the horizon. Amelia holds them by the hand and pulls them as she runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She leads them further and further away from the path, snaking through the brush. The patrol cars come even closer. Amelia ducks and hides behind one of the bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children hide with her. The patrol cars tear past her, some five hundred yards away, chasing after Santiago. We suddenly hear sirens. Then, the sound of doors slamming and unintelligible voices over a loudspeaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a few seconds, we hear distant gunshots, three, four. Amelia listens, frozen.

Anwar, sitting on a chair, with a fan clears away the flies hovering around Susan. We can hear the call to prayer and Anwar prostrates himself toward Mecca. Richard observes Anwar's prayer and then looks at Susan who moans in her sleep.

Yamile (9), a beautiful girl with large brown eyes, enters carrying a tray with cookies and tea. She greets Richard with a nod and offers him tea. Richard takes the tea.

direction.raw_text: . CHIEKO'S ROOM -- NIGHT Chieko is in her room, sitting on her bed, staring into space. The doorbell light goes on. She remains motionless for a few moments. The light goes on again. Chieko breathes in and goes to open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTRANCE TO CHIEKO'S APARTMENT -- NIGHT Chieko opens the door and runs into Kenji, who greets her as if she were just anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko, who has been unable to read his lips, asks him with her hands that he speak slowly and face her. Kenji is embarrassed by his tactlessness and tries to be more considerate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko nods and asks him in with her hand. Kenji takes off his shoes and leaves them at the door. Chieko leads him to the living room and with a gesture asks if he wants anything to drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko nods and goes into the kitchen. Kenji glances over the apartment. Chieko comes back from the kitchen holding a strange gadget which she puts on the living room table. A small bulb lights. Kenji just watches her. Chieko gestures for him to sit down.     Kenji and Chieko sit across from each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Chieko takes out her notebook and pen, writes something down and hands it over to Kenji. Kenji reads, seems surprised and reads again slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko is disconcerted at the question. She takes her notebook and starts writing. Kenji reads and turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. She gets up, asks Kenji to go with her and walks toward the balcony.
direction.name: direction
