dialogue.raw_text: Your father was asleep when she jumped off the balcony?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BALCONY, CHIEKO'S APARTMENT -- NIGHT She opens the door to the balcony and points at the void: it's over twelve floors. Kenji looks over; the distance is dizzying. Chieko writes in her notebook and shows him the piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods and writes again.    She looks perturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods again.   Kenji holds her by her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko remains motionless for a few seconds. She scrawls in her notebook "Then why do you want to talk to my father?" Kenji reads and then turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The red bulb on the gadget starts to blink. Chieko spots it from the balcony and signals to Kenji that she has to go to the kitchen. She runs off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You saw her jump?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've already told the other officers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's about a hunting rifle in his name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, CHIEKO'S APARTMENT -- NIGHT Kenji stands and looks at the photographs of Yasujiro hunting all over the world: with a kudu in Africa, a black bear in Kamchatka, Hassan and the Oryx in Morocco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Chieko comes back with a cup of steaming tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her head.   She writes something and hands it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The news weighs on Chieko; she looks away. The sounds of Tokyo come in through the living room: its car horns, its voices. Suddenly a rush of wind comes in. Chieko sees the balcony doors are open and goes to close them. She then comes back to the living room and sits down, dejected. Kenji sits down beside her and leaves the tea on the table. He doesn't know what to do and looks uncomfortable. She picks up the notebook and writes.    Kenji reads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a long silence. Chieko seems immersed in a remote, inaccessible world. Kenji turns his face to hers so that she can read his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chieko grabs his arm and shakes her head, urging him to stay. They exchange a look for an instant and Kenji insists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets up to leave. Chieko signals for him to wait for a moment and goes to her room. Kenji stands in the middle of the room, waiting.    Chieko comes back completely naked. Her skin bristles. She walks toward him, breathing through her mouth. Kenji is disconcerted when he sees the quiet teenager approach. She walks all the way up to Kenji and when she is about to take another step, he holds her back with both hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She doesn't pay attention, breaks free and stands a few inches away from him. She is almost panting. She holds out her hand and caresses Kenji's ear. He stands there, immobile, without taking his eyes off Chieko's. She takes his hand and puts it on one of her breasts. Kenji strokes her breast and then pulls his hand away. She grabs it again and puts it back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji looks turned on and confused: Chieko is beautiful, but he knows he cannot go on and takes his hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks up to his face and licks it.    He is confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs her by her arms and moves her away. She grabs the sleeve of his jacket and pulls him back. She hugs him and suddenly Chieko starts crying, disconsolate. Kenji, bewildered, first does nothing, but upon seeing Chieko's despair, holds her. She buries her face in his shoulder. Her nakedness becomes increasingly fragile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Does your father still hunt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was an incident with a rifle in your father's name. That's why we want to talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, your father isn't going to jail. We just need to talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go now. Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, no... this is wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I can't.     You're just a girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Abdullah, afraid, watches his son shoot. The police have stopped firing and run for cover. Yussef loads the rifle again and aims carefully. He shoots and, in the distance, we can see one of the headlights on a police truck shatter. Abdullah shouts at Yussef desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Furious, Yussef loads the rifle again and starts shooting at the cops. Ahmed won't stop screaming from the pain. Confused, Abdullah doesn't know if he should console his wounded son or stop the enraged Yussef. In the distance, the cops reorganize.    We hear the faraway shots of Alarid giving orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the cops gets onto a truck and uses it as a parapet. Yussef aims again, but this time the policemen are well covered. Abdullah drags himself all the way to Yussef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef turns to his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to wrest it away, but Yussef resists. The struggle and Abdullah finally pulls it away. When Yussef tries to snatch it back, the police fire a round of shots and the two barely have time to hide. The air is thick with gunshots. Yussef and Abdullah, terrified, stick to the stones. The bullets strike very close to them, and they can't even raise their heads. Ahmed won't stop complaining.    Abdullah shouts at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gunshots rain down for over a minute. When they stop, Abdullah turns to look at Ahmed, who is lying motionless on the rocks with bullet in his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oblivious of the police, he gets up and runs toward him. Motionless, Ahmed just moans. With every breath, his shirt grows bloodier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rolls Ahmed over and lays his head on his lap. Abdullah cannot stop crying. Yussef, ducking, runs toward his brother. Abdullah laments nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef is shocked upon seeing his dead brother. He stands up and, without caring whether anyone fires at him or not, he raises the rifle up in the air for the police to see that he is not aiming, and starts to break it against the rocks. When he's finished breaking it he opens his arms and walks toward the police. One of them policemen looks at him through a pair of binoculars. Alarid interrogates him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officer takes a careful look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officer watches Abdullah carrying his wounded son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alarid turns to the other officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police aim and hold Yussef in their sights. He keeps walking resolutely toward his aggressors. He is crying softly, keeping his arms open. Yussef walks until his is 10 meters away from the police and he kneels with his arms open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cautious, the police still aim at his chest. Yussef proceeds with his confession, babbling it through his nerves, his pain and his attempt to control his sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to his father and his brother and points at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alarid moves in, aiming at him with a rifle.    Behind him are five other cops, also ready to shoot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef does not obey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yussef turns his face toward Alarid looks him in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lies on the floor, crying. Alarid puts his gun down and looks at him: his enemy is a disconsolate child. Then he looks up at Abdullah who is screaming his lamentations. He turns to one of his subordinates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the officers goes to help Abdullah and Ahmed.     Yussef lies on the floor, crying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yussef, stop shooting!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move that truck... god damn it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me that rifle...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going to kill us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me that rifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahmed, don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahmed!   Ahmed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahmed!   Ahmed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't die, don't die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A boy is walking this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he armed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't look like it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are the others doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A man is holding somebody injured.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is the other one still walking this way?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I killed the American, I was the only one who shot at you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They did nothing... nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kill me, but save my brother, he did nothing... nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the ground...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Save my brother...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the ground...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Save my brother... please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go help them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- NIGHT The sun rises.   Amelia and the children keep walking.    They sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia stops and tries to distract them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike remains pensive.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't walk anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have to keep walking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why is the air so hot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (the entire dialogue in English) Because coyotes and snakes and quails have already breathed that air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're breathing the same air animals breathe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it doesn't rot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it doesn't rot.   We all breathe this air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- MORNING Dawn. The three walk through the desert.      Debbie walks mechanically, tired and exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia looks around her: no sign of civilization.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't anymore. I'm thirsty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So am I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Just a little further and we'll go look for water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- LATER Amelia lumbers heavily, carrying Debbie asleep on her arm. Mike drags his feet a few yards behind. They walk for a long stretch through the thorny brush until they reach a small mound where a leafy mesquite grows. Amelia lays a limp Debbie down on the ground and sits on the mound of earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy, exhausted and docile, obeys and lies on her chest. Amelia leans against the trunk with Debbie on her legs. The children sleep while Amelia, nodding off, tries to keep watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) We're going to rest here for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if there are snakes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, there aren't any.   Come, lie down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- LATER It is well into the morning. Amelia and the children sleep deeply. There is a noise and Amelia opens her eyes. She sees a border patrol truck driving around near them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Looking through the branches, she spies on the truck and watches another one join it. Mike awakes and sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia ducks and lays Mike face down.    The two trucks slowly approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A truck drives by about eighty yards away and then passes. The other one cuts diagonally across its path and then gets lost in the desert. Amelia gets up and shakes off the dust. She looks out of place, wearing her best clothes torn by the bramble. She makes sure the trucks are leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia freezes upon hearing the boy's words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls him toward her and hugs him tenderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia turns and tries to wake Debbie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl opens her eyes, but doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She closes her eyes again. Amelia notices her lips are dry and her breath is irregular: she is visibly dehydrated. Upon seeing that she doesn't react, Amelia looks for the trucks: they're far away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Mike, in a low voice, in Spanish) Stay still.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are we hiding if we didn't do anything wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) Because they think we did something wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not true: you're bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sweetie, I'm not bad.     I just did something stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) I love you very much, sweetie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) Debbie, we've got to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Debbie, sweetheart, wake up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- LATER Amelia carries Debbie in her arms under the burning sun, following a cattle trail. Mike walk behind, pale, sweaty. Amelia looks to the horizon: there is no sign of the trucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY They are still walking. Amelia can barely go on. She stops to rest. She is sweating copiously. Mike also looks weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- LATER The heat is strong and Amelia is beaten. She looks for the shade of a cluster of mesquites and lays Debbie down. Then she turns to Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike looks at her with imploring eyes.   Amelia caresses him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sweetie, I'm going to go look for help. Stay here and don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not staying here alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honey, you have to take care of Debbie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't be long. I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Amelia desperately looks through the desert.   She also looks dehydrated. She drifts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Amelia drags her feet as she walks.   She can go no further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY Amelia sees a small hillock and climbs it with difficulty. She surveys the environs from the top. In the distance she sees a Border Patrol truck driving down a path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . With great effort, Amelia runs down the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truck doesn't stop. Amelia keeps running, flailing her arms and screaming wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truck stops and backs up.   Amelia keeps going, tripping over stones. John (29), a thoroughly Mexican officer, gets out and she runs up, panting, to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John stares at her suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John looks at her suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John keeps staring at her.   He points to a mesquite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia obeys. John goes back to the vehicle, opens the door and sits down and grabs the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amelia doesn't manage to hear what the radio says. She looks attentively at what the agent is doing. John stops and runs back to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia despairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John pushes her forcefully against the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns around with her hands over her head.    John handcuffs her and leads her to the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Stop, stop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir... sir... stop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please help me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go get two kids I left behind in the desert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish, with a terrible accent) Are they illegal immigrants?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, they're American.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When did you cross?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) I didn't cross, I live here.   Please, help me find these kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand there and don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Attention base, I have a 4533...I have the suspect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're under arrest. Turn around and put your hands behind your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I left those kids in the desert, I swear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Turn around, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BORDER PATROL VEHICLE -- DAY Amelia, cuffed, and John, drive down a path in the desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia studies the terrain.    She points at some mesquites in the distance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Which way are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- DAY The truck parks and they both get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia explores the landscape, anguished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another border patrol truck arrives and pulls up next to them. Eliseo (34), looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sees another cluster of mesquites and points toward them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They must be around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This lady said they were here, but there's nobody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Ma'am, you're not lying to us, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) I swear they're around here somewhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They must be over that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLUSTER OF MESQUITES -- DAY They arrive at the cluster. The two trucks park and the three get out. She is still cuffed. A helicopter hovers above them. They walk around: nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't know what to say.    John grabs her by the arm and drags her toward the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia looks at him desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John is not affected.   He keeps pulling her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John pays no attention.   She turns to Eliseo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John keeps pulling her. He puts her in the truck and closes the door before Eliseo's passive gaze.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's nobody here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Eliseo, in Spanish) I left them about a kilometer in from the road.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Which road?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) I swear they're around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) John, wait, maybe she's telling the truth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe she's not, let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please sir, believe me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) I swear, they're lost, they're going to die. I have to find them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) Please no... please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ROOM, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- AFTERNOON Night begins to fall. From the window we can hear the noises of the town: voices, goats bleating, camels moaning, music from a radio. Susan wakes from her slumber and turns to Richard, who is leaning on a wall, tired, sweaty, with his eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles.   He caresses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard touches between her legs and feels the moisture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both laugh.   She grimaces in pain when she does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar looks in a corner and hands it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grandmother and Anwar exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lifts up her dress, pulls down her underpants and sets the basin under her. She puts her arm around him to pull herself up, but can't move her right arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh.   He kisses her.   We start to hear the stream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While she pees, they kiss painfully.    She starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her voice breaks up and she can barely go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He strokes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard hugs her and starts to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both laugh, and as they do, the blanket covering Susan's wound slips off. Richard sees her swollen, bruised arm. He touches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard looks worried and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Richard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you need?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Richard... if I die, take care of the kids. Especially Mike, he really needs you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to die. You can't die. You just can't.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm not going to leave them and don't you even think about leaving me, because I'll kill you like nobody's killed you before.

dialogue.raw_text: I peed my pants.

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't hold it in and I peed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to tell Mike on you, so you never scold him again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to pee again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Anwar) Can you leave us alone for a moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come, try it like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now I can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me my love. When Pat died I didn't know what to do, the pain drove me crazy... I was scared, that's why I left... forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was scared too... when I saw Pat lying still in his crib...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't my fault, it wasn't... I couldn't do anything for him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it wasn't your fault. I was wrong...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shhh... it wasn't your fault my love, it wasn't anybody's fault... Pat just left... (A beat) Forgive me, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me for not forgiving you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You missed; you got my leg.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So much... so much...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STAIRS, ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY He walks out onto the stairs and calls Anwar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar runs into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar remains pensive for a moment and then nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Anwar...Anwar...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to get her out of here. Where's the clinic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In Alnif, an hour and a half away from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you get us a car we can take her in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Richard is squatting next to Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She thinks for a moment and then nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan sighs: the effort required seems as if it will be too much, but she nods again. Richard hugs and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My love... I'm going to get you out of here.   We're going to try to take you to a clinic an hour and a half away from here. Do you think you can make it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you to be strong. Really strong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ANWAR'S HOUSE -- DAY Richard and the vet carry Susan out on a wheelbarrow. It is very difficult to move her. She is clearly in pain and groans quietly. Outside the house is the policeman with his Peugeot. Anwar is talking to him. Richard and the vet carry Susan all the way to the car. Richard stands before the policeman he humiliated earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anwar translates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The policeman nods kindly. Dozens of girls and boys and a few adults stare at the scene. Gingerly, Richard, Anwar and the vet lift her into the car and softly lay her on the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Even so, she screams in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard holds her hand and squeezes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard gets into the car, and as they're about to drive off, the shopkeeper runs up to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shopkeeper catches up to them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for lending us the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) He thanks you for lending us the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahhh... Ahhh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sweetie, you've got to hold on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) Stop... Stop...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Arabic) They're calling from the American Embassy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GENERAL STORE -- AFTERNOON Richard walks into the cubicle.    The phone is off the hook and Richard answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard awaits. In the corner of the room, he sees a goat's head covered with flies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Richard interrupts angrily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Just a moment, I'm going to put you through to ambassador Ken Clifford.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Richard Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, speaking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm very sorry about what happened to your wife, but you can be sure that the culprits will be punished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife is dying. She's in urgent need of medical attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) We're working on it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've been here for five hours. What the fuck are you waiting for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The Moroccan government won't let us use their airspace. They refused to acknowledge that this was an act of terrorism...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't wait anymore... I'm taking my wife to a clinic in Tinerhir right now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Stay put... we've settled the matter. A helicopter should arrive soon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We can't wait any longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The helicopter is on its way. Don't move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife is in critical condition. How long is the chopper going to take?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Soon... it'll be there soon... Be patient, it won't be long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . INTERROGATION ROOM, POLICE HEADQUARTERS -- EVENING Amelia sits in a room painted white. An American, his hair slicked back, dressed in a shirt and tie, sits before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia stops arguing.   She looks worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man's words hurt Amelia, who looks away to avoid crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia looks destitute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia exhales, relieved.   The policeman leans toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amelia loses her breath.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Is your full name Amelia Gloria Jordan Susilla?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you understand English?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In English) Ma'am, it was a miracle that we found those kids. I don't know how you could leave them alone in the desert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had to look for help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your reckless behavior endangered their lives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's none of your business, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've committed serious crimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just took the kids to my son's wedding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No ma'am, you did not just do that. You took them to another country without their parents' permission and you put them in danger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, I raised these kids since they were born. I take care of them day and night. I feed them breakfast, lunch and dinner. I play with them. Mike and Debbie are like my own children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sternly) But they are not your kids, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about my nephew, Santiago?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have any information on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We located the parents in Morocco. They're very angry, but they've decided not to raise charges.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nevertheless, the government of the United States has deemed you were seriously breaking the law and has decided to immediately and definitively deport you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been living here for fifteen years. My things are here, I rent a house, I made my life here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should've thought of that beforehand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to talk to a lawyer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you attempt to take this to court, I assure you you will end up in jail. If you want my advice, accept the deportation and never come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BORDER CROSSING -- EVENING A bus parks in front of the border. Several border patrol agents have formed a wall for the illegal immigrants to pass directly through. The illegal immigrants get out and walk toward Mexico.   As Amelia crosses, she keeps looking back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORDER CROSSING, MEXICO -- EVENING The illegal immigrants cross into Mexico, where they disband into small groups. Amelia walks alone. Before she walks away she turns to one of the other deported Mexicans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He acquiesces. He rummages through his pant pockets and pulls out a pack of cigarettes. He offers one to Amelia, who takes it. He also pulls out some matches and lights one.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In Spanish) Do you have a cigarette?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STREET, TIJUANA -- EVENING Amelia smokes, drifting. After a while she sits on a sidewalk and leans on a post. She looks into the street at the people passing by and starts crying softly. A dusty and battered pick up truck arrives. Inside are her son and her comadre. Her son steps down and hugs her in silence as she cries. Her comadre observes them from a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMLET -- EVENING The truck is parked in front of Anwar's house. Richard and Susan wait in the back while the boy, Anwar and the vet lean on the hood. Suddenly a helicopter with American insignia flies over them and goes to land in an empty lot. Anwar looks up and watches the helicopter descend. The helicopter kicks up a cloud of dust before the stunned gaze of dozens of children. Some camels are frightened. Some starving dogs bark at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN -- EVENING They carry Susan to the helicopter in a stretcher. They load her in carefully. Richard follows her through the wind generated by the helicopter. Anwar catches up to them to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard gives Anwar a hug which he responds to affectionately. Richard takes out his wallet and holds out three hundred- dollar bills, which Anwar rejects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look each other in the eye and then Richard gets into the chopper. It takes off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good luck, mister...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No sir, no... Allah be with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT -- EVENING The helicopter silently flies over the Moroccan desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT, MOROCCAN HOSPITAL -- EVENING The hospital's perimeter is guarded by dozens of soldiers. The security is impressive. A group of doctors and nurses with a stretcher wait in the parking lot. Several journalists and cameras observe. Ken and his entourage await the helicopter's landing. The helicopter approaches. The cameramen hurry to position themselves for a better shot. A reporter speaks to the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The helicopter settles softly in the parking lot. It is immediately surrounded by several Moroccan soldiers. The doctors on the ground prepare the stretcher. Ken walks hurriedly toward the chopper, guarding himself from the wind. Susan is immediately placed on the stretcher and quickly taken to the emergency room. Richard follows close behind until his is intercepted by Ken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard keeps running behind the stretcher.   Ken stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard looks at him as if he doesn't know what he's talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls away from Ken and follows Susan toward the E.R.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In this helicopter is Susan Jones, an American mother of two who was seriously injured in a terrorist attack. It appears fundamentalist organizations planned the attack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Jones, I'm Ken Clifford, Ambassador to the United States.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A first rate medical team is going to tend to her, but if you want we can take her to a hospital in Italy as soon as she's stable...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are lots of reporters waiting. Is there anything you want to say to the press? A statement against terrorism?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The last thing I'm worried about right now is the fucking press.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY, E.R., MOROCCAN HOSPITAL -- NIGHT Several Moroccan doctors are examining Susan.    Richard observes worriedly from a window. One of the doctors comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Moroccan doctor puts his hand on Richard's shoulder and thinks about his answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor leaves and Richard goes back to looking at his wife through the glass. The doctors are still prepping her.   Richard walks in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (In good English) We're going to have to operate immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is she going to be ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's probable. We're going to try to save her arm.   She's been bleeding internally, and there's been some clotting so there's a high risk of gangrene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (insistently, as if he hadn't heard the doctor) But she's going to be ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, she's going to be ok.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . EMERGENCY ROOM -- NIGHT He stands next to Susan, who is unconscious. He looks at a doctor and she moves to one side. Richard leans over and kisses her. He walks away and the nurses start to wheel her to the O.R.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY, MOROCCAN HOSPITAL -- NIGHT Richard is talking on the phone from an office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few seconds pass and Mike answers.   This is the phone call from the beginning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard starts to cry for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard tries to hold back his sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy keeps talking while Richard cries.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Amelia?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is everything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Ok sir, Mrs. Rachel told me. I'm very sorry. How is Mrs. Susan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're going to operate now... Amelia... take good care of the kids, and don't tell them anything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) No sir, don't worry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put Mike on please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hi dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey sweetie, how are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Dad, guess what? Today, at school, they brought some baby chickens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I held one in my hand. He was really little and he was all warm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) Dad, are you ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'm ok. Everything's fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) And Mariana wanted to take one home, but the teacher didn't let her...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CHIEKO'S APARTMENT -- NIGHT Chieko, naked, sits in an armchair, again submerged in the remote world of her silence. Before her, Kenji observes her nakedness, her sadness, her pained beauty. For a while they remain motionless. She seems to return from the long journey to herself and turns to look at him. Their eyes meet. There are still tears in Chieko's eyes. They hold each other's gaze until Chieko gets up, gets her notebook, scribbles down some words and gives them to him. Kenji reads them and looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sits down beside him. They look at each other again for a few, long seconds. Chieko takes his hand, strokes it for a moment, kisses it, sucks one of his fingers and then puts it back in its place. She grabs her notebook and starts writing a long note. It takes her almost a minute to do so. Kenji, nervous because of her proximity, watches her write feverishly. Chieko finishes writing, folds the note and hands it to Kenji. Kenji starts unfolding it, but Chieko stops him. She takes it away from him, folds it again and puts it in his breast pocket. She signals for him to read it later. Kenji gets up to go. She stands next to him. Her nakedness contrasts with Kenji's toughness. He bows his head to say goodbye and she moves aside for him to pass. Kenji walks past her as she watches. Kenji reaches the door. He opens it and turns to look at Chieko again, who has been left in the middle of the hall. He bows his head again and leaves. Chieko watches him leave and closes her eyes painfully.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to apologize for anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ELEVATOR, CHIEKO'S BUILDING -- NIGHT Kenji rides the elevator down, touched, barely able to contain his emotion. The elevator doors open and he walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOBBY, TOKYO APARTMENT BUILDING -- NIGHT Kenji walks past the doorman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He keeps walking. On the other end of the lobby, at the parking lot entrance, Yasujiro walks in. The doorman calls Kenji as he is about to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji stops.   Beside him is Yasujiro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji approaches him while the doorman discretely moves away to leave them alone in the lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yasujiro looks at him attentively. Kenji, still moved by Chieko, looks distracted, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji looks through his pockets, takes out a small notebook and looks up the missing number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yasujiro remains silent for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both bow to say goodbye. Yasujiro walks toward the elevator. Kenji calls out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji approaches and Yasujiro awaits, expectant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenji is left speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns around and leaves the building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Officer... officer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the man you were looking for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, I'm lieutenant Mamiya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, how can I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, there was an incident and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't mean to bother you, but... (a beat) Do you own a .270 caliber Winchester
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: rifle with the registration number...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't remember the license, but I did have a rifle like the one you described.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it true that you gave it to a Mr. Hassan Ibrahim, who lives in southern Morocco?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hassan Ibrahim?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says he was your guide in a hunt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hassan? Of course. He was a very good guide and I gave him the rifle. Hassan is a very kind man. Did anything happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was an attempted murder with that rifle, and the Moroccan police want to confirm it's not off the black market.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I gave it to him. (a beat) Is Hassan ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Am I legally involved?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not for the moment. You may have to go testify for your friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I leave now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your daughter told me about your wife on the balcony. I'm very sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What balcony?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About how your wife killed herself by jumping off the balcony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife never jumped off a balcony. She shot herself in the head. My daughter was the first to find her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've explained it to the police several times. Don't bother us with that anymore, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm very sorry sir, we won't bother you anymore. Good night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TOKYO STREETS -- NIGHT Kenji walks down the streets immersed in his thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR -- NIGHT Kenji sits in a half-empty bar.   He turns to the bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The T.V. has been turned on to a Japanese newscast. Kenji takes out Chieko's note, reads it and, as soon as he is done, closes his eyes. He looks around. Everybody seems to be immersed in a world far from his own. A reporter appears on T.V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan appears on screen in a wheelchair pushed by a male nurse and followed by Richard. The bartender leans over to Kenji.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he looks back at the news, the story has changed.   Kenji drinks his whisky parsimoniously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Another whisky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Susan Jones, the American woman wounded in an attack in Morocco ten days ago, left the hospital today, heading to the United States...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want something to eat?    I could make you a sandwich.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue
